text:
7.3. Multivariate MLP Models 62
We can now deﬁne an MLP model for the multivariate input where the vector length is used
for the input dimension argument.
# define model
model = Sequential()
model.add(Dense(100, activation=' relu' , input_dim=n_input))
model.add(Dense(1))
model.compile(optimizer=' adam' , loss=' mse' )
Listing 7.23: Example of deﬁning an MLP that expects a ﬂattened multivariate time series as
input.
